snippet: A federal appeals panel heard arguments on Wednesday over Gov. Lincoln Chafee’s refusal to surrender a murder suspect to federal prosecutors.
abstract: Federal appeals panel hears arguments over Rhode Island Gov Lincoln Chafee’s refusal to surrender murder suspect Jason W Pleau to federal prosecutors; Chafee is concerned that if Pleau is tried in federal court, he will face death penalty, punishment Rhode Island does not have.
lead_paragraph: A federal appeals panel heard arguments on Wednesday over Gov. Lincoln Chafee’s refusal to surrender a murder suspect to federal prosecutors.

headline.main: Rhode Island: Federal Prosecutors Fight Governor Over Murder Suspect
headline.print_headline: Rhode Island: Federal Prosecutors Fight Governor Over Murder Suspect
